title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. IV, subch. A, Juvenile Delinquency Forms (Family Court Act Article 3), form 3-42 - Order (sealing of official records)
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. IV, subch. A, Juvenile Delinquency Forms (Family Court Act Article 3), form 3-42 - Order (sealing of official records)

State Regulations

Sec. 375.1 F.C.A. Form 3-42
(Juvenile Delinquency)
7/83

At a term of the Family Court of the State
of New York, held in and for the County of ________, at ________, New York, on
________. P R E S E N T: Hon. ______
Judge
________
In the Matter of Docket No. ________
________ ORDER
(Sealing of Official Records)
A Person Alleged to be
a Juvenile Delinquent, ________ Respondent. ________
A petition under article 3 of the Family

Court Act, sworn to on ________, 19 ________, having been filed in this Court
alleging that the above-named Respondent is a juvenile delinquent; and

It appearing that the juvenile delinquency
proceeding was terminated in favor of the Respondent as defined in subdivision
2 of section
375.1
of the

Family Court Act; and

It appearing further that (a) (no) motion
has been made by the (Presentment Agency) (Court sua sponte) that the interests
of justice require that the records herein not be sealed (and notice having
been duly given to Respondent); and
[FN1](It appearing further that it has
(not) been demonstrated to the satisfaction of the Court that the interests of
justice so require); NOW therefore, it is hereby
ORDERED, that all official records and
papers, including judgments and orders of the court, but not including public
court decisions or opinions or records and briefs on appeal, relating to the
arrest, the prosecution and the probation service proceedings, including all
duplicates of copies thereof, on file with the Court, police agency, probation
service and Presentment Agency (not) be sealed and (not made available to any
person or public or private agency.) (and it is further)
(ORDERED
____________
____________). Dated: ________, 19________. ENTER
______________
J. F.C. [FN1] Delete if inapplicable. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. IV, subch. A, Juvenile Delinquency

Forms (Family Court Act Article 3), form
3-42

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
